github-issues.title: `feat`: setup multi-selectors for jira issue types w/ api proxy | `Draft`

labels.name: type/feature-development
labels.description: This PR is to develop a new feature

github-issues.body: ### Config-UI / Data Integrations / JIRA / Issue Type Mappings > WIP DO NOT MERGE - [ ] Implement **Multiselect** Component for **Type Mappings** - Requirement Tags - Bug Tags - Incident Tags - [ ] Implement **Select** Component for **Epic Key** - [ ] Implement **Select** Component for **Story Point Field** - [ ] Fetch **Issue Types** and Fields using **JIRA API Proxy** - [ ] Test/Verify Issue Type Mappings Object - [ ] Test Save Settings - [ ] Test READ Settings ### Description This PR adds usability improvements to JIRA settings by converting the multi-tag input widgets to Multiselect widgets for **JIRA's Issue Type Mappings**. This will allow the user to select tags from a predefined list using the JIRA API Proxy, rather than manual entry. ### Does this close any open issues? #1064 ### Screenshots

github-issues.title: grafana password got reset after service restarted

labels.name: type/bug
labels.description: This issue is a bug

github-issues.body:
## Describe the bug
![middle_img_v2_54bdc4d2-9a55-4926-96e9-37114ef8700g](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61080/151643170-ad9b6093-baab-4c46-83a9-0093fef5edf5.png)

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Change `mysql` password in `docker-compose.yml`
2. Update `mysql` password in `grafana` datasource
3. Click on `save & test`, make sure connection is working
4. Restart `grafana` service by running `docker-compose restart grafana`
5. Go to `gafana` data source page, click on `save & test`, see error

## Expected behavior
mysql password won't get reset in grafana

github-issues.title: Panic caused by Removed Jira issue

labels.name: type/bug
labels.description: This issue is a bug

github-issues.body:
## Describe the bug
If the issue was removed, the HTTP response would be an `object` instead of an `array`. Unmarshaling an `object` into `golang` slice gives rise to panic.

## Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8455907/151531722-bb596773-ec6f-4f85-8bc2-b8a40739f144.png)
![fyCb2ixNqn](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8455907/151531447-17b553ba-d6e6-48ee-b103-c1dd0d6ceb1a.png)
![REzVyi35tB](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8455907/151531484-95cf6614-efb2-45d8-8970-0ecd8d062be7.png)

github-issues.title: Add '_' before tool layer tables to differentiate them from domain layer tables

labels.name: type/feature-development
labels.description: This PR is to develop a new feature

github-issues.body:
## Description
The 2 series of tables are mixed up:
- for users who have no idea the difference between the tool-layer and domain-layer tables: be confused about why there're 2 issues tables, Github_issues and issues. 
- for users who know the difference: it's hard to find a table in the DB management tool as domain layer tables are mixed with tool layer tables.

![iXK5VEMxu1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14050754/151532072-62424f07-2d15-4a1e-b997-ec5f691a9bc7.png)

## A better practice
Clear difference by table name: `_raw`, `_tmp`, or with no `_`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14050754/151533161-63daa2f1-6943-4a81-aa47-4515724cfc5f.png)

github-issues.title: How do domainlayer.issues relate to domainlayer.repos

labels.name: type/question
labels.description: This issue is a question

github-issues.body: ## Question If I have collected from two different repos with github collection, I expect there to be two records in the `repos` table. Since there are more than one repo that an issue can belong to, how would I write a sql query to find the matching results? The issues model: The repo model: I guess I expected a join table here. Am I doing this wrong? @klesh

github-issues.title: Github tool layer is not collecting url as it should

labels.name: type/bug
labels.description: This issue is a bug

labels.name: priority/low
labels.description: This issue is not important

github-issues.body: ## Describe the bug When we collect from the github plugin, we have `url` in the db but we are not collecting it for any records. This was found on 52.89.41.35:44306 for pingCap data. I don't think we are using this anywhere so far but we should collect it if the column exists in the db

github-issues.title: Creating pipeline with raw json

labels.name: type/feature-request
labels.description: This issue is a proposal for something new

labels.name: priority/medium
labels.description: This issue is medium important

labels.name: component/config-ui
labels.description: This PR modifies config-ui

github-issues.body:
## Description
Often, we have a plugin ready on backend first, and `config-ui` may or may not support it in next couple of iterations.
This is awkard when we have delivery features to users in a short timeframe.

## Describe the solution you'd like
Allow user to create pipeline in Advanced / Raw JSON Mode. And, before this feature, we should bring back `triggers` page as a temporary measure.

github-issues.title: Main readme update proposal
github-issues.body: 1. Team code Icon is broken 2. Main screenshot is out of date 3. Config ui screenshots will be out of date once we merge in the multi stage code 4. Do we still have 20+ metrics? Maybe this should be re-worded to the three questions we solve 5. We support more plugins now but I think these are the only 4 in the config ui. They are also the only four that can be used by the every day developer. Should we update this list? 6. Update the readme to no longer get users to go to the triggers page. Instead, we should tell them how to set up a pipeline 7. We no longer support compose profiles I am going to go ahead and fix all of these but maybe @Startrekzky can look this over to validate it is what he wants

labels.name: type/feature-request

github-issues.body:
## Description
We have supported GitlabCI for months, but users still can't see the configure via Config-UI, as there's no entry for `GitlabCI` in the integration page and pipeline page.

## Describe the solution you'd like
The configuration of the GitlabCI plugin is similar to the Jenkins Plugin. Please talk to @joncodo to get more information about this plugin.

## Has the Feature been Requested Before?
No

github-issues.title: GitLab: Merge Request Notes

labels.name: type/question
labels.description: This issue is a question

labels.name: QA
labels.description: Issue or question found by our QA process

github-issues.body:
## Question
We are collecting / storing 2 types of MR notes in GitLab.
1. `system` = 1 (non-human)
2. `system` = 0 (human)

My question is: Do we have a use for the first type (non-human notes)? If not, should we only be saving human comments? 

I want to bring this issue to everyone's attention to make sure we are only using the 2nd type when we are computing metrics relating to human comments.

@Startrekzky @klesh

There are more records of `sprint_issues` than `jira_sprint_issues` after running the Jira plugin. I expect the same number after conversion. Is there any valid reason why there would be more after conversion? @klesh

github-issues.title: Domain layer naming: "Changelogs"

labels.name: QA
labels.description: Issue or question found by our QA process

github-issues.title: When we say "Users" do we mean "Human Users"?

labels.name: type/question
labels.description: This issue is a question

labels.name: QA
labels.description: Issue or question found by our QA process

github-issues.body:
## Question
When we say "Users" do we mean "Human Users"?

When we collect users from Jira, we get two types. 
1. accountType = "app" (non-human)
2. accountType = "atlassian" (human)

In the domain layer, we are converting both types into users, without distinguishing between the two. Is this what we want, or do we want only human users?

## Screenshots
Example 1: users in the domain layer include slack and trello.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27032263/150539474-38536c3a-bcd8-4545-b536-299d84d3648c.png)

Example 2: Users in Jira can be "app" or "atlassian"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27032263/150539881-cd6b4318-48c0-4402-a857-cbb5c1261779.png)

@Startrekzky

github-issues.title: Scrape recent metrics from the server

labels.name: type/feature-request
labels.description: This issue is a proposal for something new

labels.name: component/plugins
labels.description: This PR modifies one or more plugins

github-issues.body:
## Description
According issue #931 , we can add a feature to get recent data since a fix time through plugins

## Describe the solution you'd like
We can use api links as below 
1. github issue api link: https://docs.github.com/en/github-ae@latest/rest/reference/commits
- since:   Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  
2. gitlab merge request api link: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/merge_requests.html
- created_after: Return merge requests created on or after the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)
- updated_after:  Return merge requests updated on or after the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)
But still need more work to verify if we can get right data by the params

## Has the Feature been Requested Before?
issue #931
